metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16933 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
etc/initsystem/prepare-dirs in Icinga 2.x through 2.8.1 has a chown call for a filename in a user-writable directory, which allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging access to the $ICINGA2_USER account for creation of a link.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-16933` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

icinga2 - 2.10.2-1
icinga2-bin - 2.10.2-1
icinga2-common - 2.10.2-1
icinga2-ido-mysql - 2.10.2-1
icinga2-ido-pgsql - 2.10.2-1
vim-icinga2 - 2.10.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: icinga2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.2-1').
